_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: Water sump below bromine storage and off-loading area.
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Reduced 1225 Klbs flammables by elimination of TK-5002
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butyl Polymers Plant is divided into five sections for PHA (Hazop) analysis.  All are completed on a scheduled 5-year maximum cycle.  The information below reflects the most recent analysis on June 16, 2003.  the Butyl Polymers Plant and assocated offsite storage prevention plan is common with the prevention programs of all other units inthe Baytown Chemical Plant as summarized in the Executive summary.  These programs are essentially the same as our PSM programs that have been well established for a number of years.  Several operations improvements have been made over the last five years including reduction in use of one "flammable" sphere storage tank with significant reduction of stored flammable material (1225 Klbs.).  The Butyl Polymers Plant is covered by RMP flammable and acute toxic rule.

North West Chemical Offsite (NWC Offsite).  This process is also covered by OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for NWC Offsite is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined iin the Executive Summary.  There has been a reduction itn the stored "flammables" by taking one sphere storage tank (1252Klbs) and change of two (178 Klbs each) bullet storage vessels from flammables to non-hazardous (instrument/plant air) service.  The NWC offsite meets the requirements of RMP flammable.

LPU Hazop Analysis was performed on 06/15/2001, XPU/PTU/Fractionation/Offsite on 01/25/2001.  This process is also covered by OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for the LPU/PTU/XPU is the same for all units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The LPU/PTU/XPU is covered by RMP acute toxic rule.

WCU/CT-70  This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for Water Clarification Unit/Cooling Tower-70 is the same as for all other units at the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary. The WCU/CT-70 meets the requirements for RMP acute toxic rule.

This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for the Isobutylene Unit is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The IBU meets the requirements of RMP flammable rule.

_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Reduced total hydrocarbon inventory, all anhydrous ammonia removed.
_prev_prog_3.Description: DHU-The Diene Hydrogenation Unit was former the Polybutene Unit.  Several operations changed including reduction of flammable volume and total elimination of the regulated ammonia.  This process also complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for the DHU is the same for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The DHU is no longer covered for acute toxic but still meets the requirements of the RMP flammable rule.

Polypropylene area is divided into five segments for PHA HAZOP analysis.  The analysis dates range from 09/25/2000 to most recent analysis on 12/15/2003.  This process also complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for Polypropylene Unit is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  BAPP is covered by the RMP flammable rule.

This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for Cooling Tower #17 is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The CT-17 is covered by RMP acute toxic rule.

This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for the Isoamylene Unit is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The IAU is covered by the RMP flammable rule.

This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for the Paraxylene Feed unit is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The PFU is covered by the RMP flammable rule.

The prevention program for the Aromatics Extraction Unit is the same as for all other units inthe Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The only portion of the AXU that is technically covered by the RMP rule is the Col. 2 B overhead circuit.  Column 2 B replaced Column 5/4 in the first quarter of 2004 and is now covered by the RMP flammable rule.

This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for the Benzene Hydrofining Unit is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The BHU is covered by RMP under the flammable rule.

BTEC-W Pilot Unit complies with OSHA PSM requirements.  The prevention program is the same for all units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  BTEC-W Pilot Unit meets the requiremtns of the RMP Rule.

BPU complies with OSHA PSM requirements.  The prevention program for the Butene Processing Unit is the sam for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The BPU meets the requirements of the RMP flammable rule.

This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for the Propylene Concentration Unit is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The PCU meets the requirements for the RMP flammable rule.

This process complies with OSHA PSM.  The prevention program for the Syngas Unit is the same as for all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The SGU meets the requirements for the RMP flammable rule.

BTEC-E Pilot Unit complies with the OSHA PSM requirements.  The prevention program for this unit is the same as all other units in the Baytown Chemical Plant as outlined in the Executive Summary.  The BTEC-E Pilot Unit meets the requirements of the RMP flammable rule.
